content.speaker_notes:
Module Layout: 
Explain how you will be teaching the learning objectives and incorporating your storyline. List and describe any demos, learning activities or exercise files you will be using.
Scenario Setup (2 min): Three acquired companies with conflicting security practices
Organization Policies (4 min):
Security settings deep dive
Mandatory vs recommended configs
Policy templates
Repository Baselines (3 min):
Branch protection as enforcement
Required status checks
Exception handling
Reusable Workflows (3 min):
Workflow templates for security
Centralized management patterns
Version control strategies
Compliance Tracking (3 min):
Security overview navigation
API queries for reporting
Automated compliance checks

content.title: “MedTech Corp just lost $5.2M from exposed AWS keys. That could've been us.”
text_content: Elena Rodriguez, VP of Engineering, Globomantics Robotics Division

structure.content_summary: The slide highlights a real-world incident where MedTech Corp lost $5.2M due to exposed AWS keys, serving as a cautionary tale for the audience. It features a title emphasizing the financial impact and a subtitle introducing the speaker, Elena Rodriguez, VP of Engineering at Globomantics Robotics Division.

content.title: Your Mission in 15 Minutes
text_content: Transform 500+ repos from vulnerable to protected
content.speaker_notes:
Here’s the mission: take 500+ repos from vulnerable to protected in under 15 minutes.
This isn’t theory. This is real-world GitHub Enterprise work. And we’re breaking it down into four clean steps.
Prerequisites: Do you have the right GHAS licenses? Admin perms? Basic hygiene stuff.
Navigation: You need to know where GHAS lives in the UI and CLI—GitHub hides the good stuff.
Enablement: This is the heart of it. One script, one GraphQL mutation, and suddenly your fleet is secure.
Verification: Trust but verify. We’ll check the rollout actually took, both visually and via CLI.
That’s the flow. Fast, surgical, repeatable. Let’s get to it.

learning_objectives: Transform 500+ repos from vulnerable to protected in under 15 minutes
structure.content_summary: Introduction to a mission involving transforming 500+ repositories from vulnerable to protected in under 15 minutes, broken down into four steps.
This slide lists the prerequisites needed for GitHub Advanced Security (GHAS), including necessary licenses and admin access.
